User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b10pre) Gecko/20110111 Firefox/4.0b10pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b10pre) Gecko/20110111 Firefox/4.0b10pre

The fullscreen toolbar is not ergonomic.  It is difficult and inconvenient to use with a mouse, because of the lack of a hide delay.

Consider the following:

1. I move the mouse to the top of the screen to reveal the hidden toolbar.
2. I immediately move it down to access a button, but accidentally overshoot.
3. the toolbar then disappear immediately

There are two possible solutions:

IE allows a "dead space" below the hidden fullscreen toolbar.  The mouse needs to move a certain number of pixels *below* the toolbar before the toolbar is hidden again.  I would prefer this behaviour.

Another possibility is to introduce a delay before hiding the toolbar again.

Reproducible: Always
comments.creator: szhorvat@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
Can anyone please test and confirm this?

In my opinion, a delay would be a temporary solution (not the best one, but still much better than the current behaviour).

Let me clarify again:

Suppose that the user wants to enter a new URL in full screen mode (or click a button, or do anything that involves "toolbar"-interaction).  This is what might very likely happen:

1. The user moved the mouse up, so the toolbar appears
2. Immediately she moves the mouse down to target the relevant UI element (address bar).
3. She "overshoots", moving the mouse pointer below the (narrow) toolbar
4. The toolbar disappears immediately, the whole process needs to start again.

Whenever using the auto-hide fullscreen toolbar, one must be extra careful not to move the mouse too fast.  I don't believe I'm the only one who finds this frustrating.

comments.text:
This bug has been fixed! it seems (not sure exactly when).
I'm on Windows 8.1. Firefox release channel 42.
Results:
1. Press F11 to go into 'Full Screen' mode: All toolbars auto-hides/transitions away.
2. Hover top of window: Toolbars immediately reveal hidden toolbar.
3. Move mouse, so it hovers as much as - I don't know - around 60px away/under toolbar: Toolbar keeps showing.
4. Move mouse even lower than this extra space: Toolbar auto-hides again.

(In reply to Szabolcs Horvát from comment #4)
> Can anyone please test and confirm this?
It seems to have been fixed, so not any longer, can you confirm this?
> In my opinion, a delay would be a temporary solution (not the best one, but
> still much better than the current behaviour).
No delay seems to have been implemented - instead a extra 'no auto-hide hover-zone' was implemented.
Judging by your comments, it seems you are fine with a 'delay', not being choosen as part of the solution?
> Whenever using the auto-hide fullscreen toolbar, one must be extra careful
> not to move the mouse too fast. I don't believe I'm the only one who finds
> this frustrating.
Could you please comment on whether you find the chosen height of the currently implemented 'no auto-hide hover-zone', below the toolbar, to be large enough?
Also, maybe Mozilla can comment, providing info as to how large the height of this zone is exactly - and whether it is configurable by the user or "hard-coded"/needing fx add-on to modify?
comments.author: evaparotangcote@mail.com
